001package net.tvburger.jdl.cnn;
002
003import java.util.ArrayList;
004import java.util.List;
005
006// For now only supports 2D pooling
007public class PoolingLayer implements ConvolutionalNetworkLayer {
008
009    private final ConvolutionalShape inputShape;
010    private final ConvolutionalShape outputShape;
011    private final PoolingFunction poolingFunction;
012    private final int size;
013    private final int stride;
014    private final int padding;
015
016    public static PoolingLayer create(int width, int height, int size, PoolingFunction poolingFunction) {
017        ConvolutionalShape inputShape = new ConvolutionalShape(width, height, ConvolutionalShape.DEFAULT_CHANNELS, ConvolutionalShape.DEFAULT_COUNT, null);
018        return create(inputShape, size, poolingFunction);
019    }
020
021    public static PoolingLayer create(ConvolutionalShape inputShape, int size, PoolingFunction poolingFunction) {
022        return create(inputShape, size, size, 0, poolingFunction);
023    }
024
025    public static PoolingLayer create(ConvolutionalShape inputShape, int size, int stride, int padding, PoolingFunction poolingFunction) {
026        int outputWidth = (inputShape.getWidth() - size + 2 * padding) / stride + 1;
027        int outputHeight = (inputShape.getHeight() - size + 2 * padding) / stride + 1;
028        ConvolutionalShape outputShape = new ConvolutionalShape(outputWidth, outputHeight, ConvolutionalShape.DEFAULT_CHANNELS, ConvolutionalShape.DEFAULT_COUNT, null);
029        return new PoolingLayer(inputShape, outputShape, poolingFunction, size, stride, padding);
030    }
031
032    private PoolingLayer(ConvolutionalShape inputShape, ConvolutionalShape outputShape, PoolingFunction poolingFunction, int size, int stride, int padding) {
033        this.inputShape = inputShape;
034        this.outputShape = outputShape;
035        this.poolingFunction = poolingFunction;
036        this.size = size;
037        this.stride = stride;
038        this.padding = padding;
039    }
040
041    @Override
042    public ConvolutionalShape getInputShape() {
043        return inputShape;
044    }
045
046    @Override
047    public ConvolutionalShape getOutputShape() {
048        return outputShape;
049    }
050
051    public PoolingFunction getPoolingFunction() {
052        return poolingFunction;
053    }
054
055    public int getSize() {
056        return size;
057    }
058
059    public int getStride() {
060        return stride;
061    }
062
063    public int getPadding() {
064        return padding;
065    }
066
067    @Override
068    public ConvolutionalShape transform(ConvolutionalShape input) {
069        ConvolutionalShape output = getOutputShape().clone();
070        for (int i = 0; i < output.getCount(); i++) {
071            for (int c = 1; c <= output.getChannels(); c++) {
072                for (int y = 0; y < output.getHeight(); y++) {
073                    for (int x = 0; x < output.getWidth(); x++) {
074                        for (ConvolutionalShape window : getWindows(input)) {
075                            float value = poolingFunction.pool(window.getElements());
076                            output.setElement(value, x, y, c, i);
077                        }
078                    }
079                }
080            }
081        }
082        return output;
083    }
084
085    private List<ConvolutionalShape> getWindows(ConvolutionalShape input) {
086        List<ConvolutionalShape> windows = new ArrayList<>();
087        for (int x = -padding; x <= input.getWidth() - size + padding; x = x + stride) {
088            for (int y = -padding; y <= input.getHeight() - size + padding; y = y + stride) {
089                for (int c = 1; c <= input.getChannels(); c++) {
090                    for (int i = 0; i < input.getCount(); i++) {
091                        ConvolutionalShape window = new ConvolutionalShape(size, size);
092                        for (int yi = 0; yi < window.getHeight(); yi++) {
093                            for (int xi = 0; xi < window.getWidth(); xi++) {
094                                float value;
095                                if (x + xi < 0 || x + xi >= input.getWidth() || y + yi < 0 || y + yi >= input.getHeight()) {
096                                    value = 0f;
097                                } else {
098                                    value = input.getElement(x + xi, y + yi, c, i);
099                                }
100                                window.setElement(value, xi, yi, c, i);
101                            }
102                        }
103                        windows.add(window);
104                    }
105                }
106            }
107        }
108        return windows;
109    }
110}
